text: Constanza Romero (born March 8, 1958)https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KJNK-BXL is an American artist and costume designer. Romero's parents divorced in 1969. Her mother found a teaching job in Fresno, California, and moved there with Romero and her younger sister and two younger brothers. In 1972 her mother died of breast cancer, and the four children went to live with a maternal aunt and uncle near Fresno. Romero met playwright August Wilson in 1990 when her Yale School of Drama teachers assigned her to design costumes for his play, The Piano Lesson. The couple married in 1994, and had one child, Azula Carmen Wilson. Wilson died in October 2005.August Wilson bio, post-gazette.com; accessed October 30, 2014. Romero has twice been nominated for a Tony Award for Best Costume Design of a Play (in 2005 and 2010, respectively).Profile, ibdb.com; accessed October 30, 2014. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:American costume designers Category:People from Fresno, California Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Yale School of Drama alumni
